title: Amy Pejkovic stuns in pink as she leads celebrity arrivals at Spring Champion Stakes Day
text:
She's the Australian high jumper who has taken the modelling world by storm.

And it's not hard to see why, with Amy Pejkovic absolutely stunning as she stepped out at the Moet & Chandon Spring Champion Stakes Day at Sydney's Royal Randwick on Saturday.

The 26-year-old blonde flaunted her figure in a pink, skintight dress as she led red carpet arrivals at the event.

Pretty in pink! Model and high jumper Amy Pejkovic (pictured) stunned in a figure-hugging dress as she led celebrity arrivals at the Moet & Chandon Spring Champion Stakes Day at Royal Randwick on Saturday

The blonde bombshell's frock featured an Ombré design, with the top of the dress being a lighter pink compared to the bottom.

The frock was sleeveless in design and featured a plunging neckline.

She teamed the look with strappy black high heels and a black bow in her hair.

Gorgeous! The blonde bombshell's frock featured an Ombré design, with the top of the dress being a lighter pink compared to the bottom

All in the details! Her makeup included dewy foundation, a deep pink lip and lashings of mascara. She swept her hair into a low messy bun and carried a silver BVLGARI bag

Her makeup included dewy foundation, a deep pink lip and lashings of mascara.

She swept her hair into a low messy bun and carried a silver BVLGARI bag.

Also stepping out in pink was model, actress and singer Erin Holland, 30.

In good company: Also stepping out in pink was model, actress and singer Erin Holland, 30 (pictured)

The brunette put her trim pins on display in a Nicola Finetti minidress, which featured a high neckline and long sleeves.

She teamed the look with a snakeskin clutch and matching heels.

She also accessorised with a pink headband and cat-eye sunglasses.

Looking good! The brunette put her trim pins on display in a Nicola Finetti minidress, which featured a high neckline and long sleeves

In the pink! She teamed the look with a snakeskin clutch and matching heels. She also accessorised with a pink headband and cat-eye sunglasses

Cricket WAG Dani Willis wore a stunning one-shoulder dress, which was off-white in colour.

The dress hugged her curves in all the right places and featured a layered thigh-split.

She wore her short locks in a low bun and a gold headband.

Opting for floral was model Nikki Phillips, 36.

The blonde wore a long sleeve white floral blouse, which she teamed with a layered black floral skirt.

Turning heads: Cricket WAG Dani Willis (pictured) wore a stunning one-shoulder dress, which was off-white in colour

Eye-catching! She wore her short locks in a low bun and a gold headband

Blooming lovely! Opting for floral was model Nikki Phillips, 36 (pictured). The blonde wore a long sleeve white floral blouse, which she teamed with a layered black floral skirt

Stylish: She completed her look with a red braided headband and her locks out in loose tousled curls

She completed her look with a red braided headband and her locks out in loose tousled curls.

Ksenija Lukich opted for a beige trouser suit, which she teamed with black heels.

She added a pop of pink with a pink handbag and wore a bright red lip.

Alli Simpson, who is the younger sister of Australian singer Cody Simpson, stepped out in a white and yellow blouse by Zimmermann and white shorts.

The 21-year-old looked chic with a white headband on and drop earrings.

Suits you: Ksenija Lukich (pictured) opted for a beige trouser suit, which she teamed with black heels

Chic! Alli Simpson (pictured), who is the younger sister of Australian singer Cody Simpson, stepped out in a white and yellow blouse by Zimmermann and white shorts
description: She's the Australian high jumper who has taken the modelling world by storm.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
